page.title: 12ST.BREWARD CHURCH,ALTAR
page.content: DURING 1985 A NEW GRANITE ALTAR WAS INSTALLED IN THE CHURCH.THE TOP WEIGHS 1200lbs AND EACH LEG WEIGHS ABOUT 200lbs. THE OLD ALTAR WAS MADE OF WOOD NOT GRANITE. THE ALTAR WAS MADE BY TWO LOCAL QUARRIES, HANTERGANTICK AND DELANK. HANTERGANTICK MADE THE LEGS AND DELANK MADE THE TOP.ON EACH CORNER OF THE ALTAR AND IN THE MIDDLE THERE IS A CROSS.TO GET THE ALTAR INSIDE THEY HAD TO TAKE THE DOOR OF THE CHURCH OFF IT'S HINGES. THE DOORS ARE VERY THICK AND WEIGH QUITE A BIT. THE NEW ALTAR WAS CONSECRATED ON 9TH SEPTEMBER BY THE RT.REV. PETER MUMFORD, BISHOP OF TRURO AT A SPECIAL SERVICE AT WHICH A LARGE PROPORTION OF THE VILLAGE COMMUNITY, INCLUDING THE MEN WHO HAD WORKED ON THE ALTAR, WERE PRESENT.
